headline: Tylenol trust crisis: Trump, RFK Jr. and Texas lawsuits slam Kenvue
summary: Kenvue, the company that makes Tylenol, is fighting on both the political and scientific fronts. The latest blow came from the U.S. Health Secretary, placing even more pressure on Kenvue stock, which has already lost 40% of its value in the last six months. Robert F. headline: Kimberly-Clark Strikes $40 Billion Deal for Tylenol Maker Kenvue
summary: One of biggest takeovers so far this year will create a global company with annual revenues of roughly $32 billion.

raw.headline: Kimberly-Clark Strikes $40 Billion Deal for Tylenol Maker Kenvue
raw.summary: One of biggest takeovers so far this year will create a global company with annual revenues of roughly $32 billion.

headline: Kimberly-Clark Buying Tylenol Maker Kenvue in $40 Billion Deal
summary: Kimberly-Clark agreed to buy Kenvue in a deal worth roughly $40 billion in a combination that could create a company with $32 billion in revenue and allow it to surpass Unilever to become the second-biggest seller of health and wellness products after Procter & Gamble. Eric Pfanner reports on Bloomberg Television.
